description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

Pulling on your technical and leadership expertise, you lead end-to-end research projects in multiple areas of expertise across data center facilities and manage a team of direct reports working on equipment installation, troubleshooting and debugging.

As a Technical Lead, you'll help deliver products that impact the technical infrastructure at Google. You'll provide leadership to Hardware Engineers in an innovative and fast-paced environment with a focus on physical implementation. You'll own and drive complex technical projects from the concept/planning stage through execution and closure. As a Technical Lead, you'll motivate the team to deliver excellent designs in multiple application areas.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience in Application-Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) implementation methodologies, IP integration and physical design in 16nm and 28nm process nodes, STA, formal verification, CDC and power analysis using industry standard CAD tools.
  • 5 years of management experience in ASIC development teams.
  • Experience in leading physical design teams working on digital designs that have taped-out and produced working silicon. Experience in solving physical design issues and technical innovation.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • Experience in IP integration (e.g., memories, IO’s and Analog IP), ASIC model as a customer or vendor, and working knowledge of Verilog/SystemVerilog.
  • Experience in solving physical design challenges across various technologies such as embedded processors, DDR, networking fabrics, etc.
  • Demonstrated fundamentals in chip design and implementation topics (e.g., micro-architecture design, digital design, design verification, physical design, integration, EDA, power optimization, synthesis, timing, etc.).
  • Ability to motivate and lead a team.
  • Ability to collaborate and influence others using engineering solutions. Excellent attention to detail.
responsibilities:
• Lead a team of physical design engineers, who work on multiple complex tape outs. Evaluate and develop physical design methodologies, tools and automation scripts for various implementation steps.
  • Create execution plans for projects and manage team efforts from concept to working silicon in volume. Manage vendor engagements and provide technical evaluations of vendors, process nodes and IP and provide recommendations.
  • Participate in design reviews and track issue resolution, and engage in technical and schedule tradeoff discussions. Collaborate with teams across Google to identify and create strategic opportunities for custom silicon innovation.
  • Understand architecture and design specifications with the larger team, and define physical design strategies and tactics to meet quality and schedule goals. Grow and develop a high-performing team by recruiting new members and developing the existing team.
  • Work closely with architecture, design and implementation stakeholders to provide status and iterative milestones. Make design decisions throughout the development process.
title: Technical Lead, Physical Design
